title: Our Laddie
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: Losh, butI'm thinkin' ' Alexander Armstrong, Esquireo' Craigneuk,' wull ken the inside o' HisMajesty's j He afore mony days are by.

title: Our Laddie
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: Good Heavens! what causes him to utteran exclamation of profound amazement,succeeded by one of ecstatic joy ? Hehastily looks at the cover, and sees inscribed thereon "Alexander Armstrong, Esquire of Craigneuk."

title: Our Laddie
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: But almost before the words had left his lips,Ella was speeding towards The Glen, and Sarahwas walking quickly back to Craigneuk.

title: Our Laddie
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: Early that morning she started for Craigneuk.

title: Our Laddie
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: 'THE pleasantest room at Craigneuk wasthe kitchen, with its huge fireplace,
